metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certainPython applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input,as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occursbecause sprintf is used unsafely.

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
